meta.job_title: Director of Information and Design Technology

duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide strategic and tactical direction for the acquisition, development, and integration of information and design technology resources and services.
Oversee all information and design technology resources, operations, and projects.
Provide leadership, guidance, and advice on new products, best practices, and operating standards for all technology matters.
Direct and oversee the design, development, and maintenance of computer and communications systems.
Supervise all departmental staff including recruitment, retention, training, and performance evaluation.
Provide backup support with Microsoft Administration, Network Firewall Administration, and Multi-Factor-Authentication.
Oversee web page and publication development, recommend and implement policies for improved electronic publishing and communication.
Direct and oversee creative services, project management, and security and privacy of information systems.
Research, design, and recommend technology-related solutions, drive projects from initiation to completion.
Communicate technology-related changes, enhancements, and modifications to management and staff.
Develop long- and short-range plans to support the organization's mission and strategic plan.
Identify measurements for evaluating the performance of the department programs and services and implement service-oriented policies.
Foster cooperation and teamwork within the department and other organizational units.
Maintain knowledge of state-of-the-art technology, equipment, systems, and technologies driving data and telecommunication networks and systems.
Model behavior that values diversity and incorporates inclusive and culturally competent practices.
Serves as bar liaison to committees and sections as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university with a degree in IT, computer science, or a related field. Four years of experience managing an IT and network systems department.
